name: Pharmacovigilance Electronic Reporting Tool
description: PvERS II is a web and mobile based solution which provides reporting and surveillance functionalities of  individual case study reports (ICSR) and consumer reporting in pharmacovigilance.

SDGs.evidenceText: The solution is focused in supporting the development and research of safe vaccines/drugs by providing a way for all consumers to report on adverse effects they may experience in the use of medical products.  This provides a way for regulators to act promptly to vaccines and drugs that may be causing harm to the public. It also provides a more accurate data pool on the side effects experienced which can be used to improve a vaccine or drug.

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism: Data is extracted via PDF/PNG/CSV for individual indicators (e.g gender)

privacyComplianceList: Kenya Standards and Guidelines for E-Health Systems Interoperability: https://pdf.usaid.gov/pdf_docs/PA00TB28.pdf
The Kenya Data Protection Act 2019: https://www.odpc.go.ke/dpa-act/

standardsList: File exchange formats as ICH E2B CIOMS

preventHarm.additionalInfoMechanismProcessesPolicies: It has inbuilt flags to identify serious cases for rapid response. It also provides a communication platform that allows for clarification on reported cases. There are also reminders sent to reporters for any unsubmitted reports.

dataPrivacySecurity.privacySecurityDescription:
Data collected is transmitted via a secure HTTP channel and is therefore encrypted on transit to prevent possible interception and interference. 
    Data extracted from the system is stripped off the PII data before sharing. 
All provisions of the DPA 2016 (and other local legal and regulatory requirements) are fully implemented.
